subNodes.conversationText: root
As you approach the bend in this road, <FirstName> hears voices calling out, and then sees some men waving their arms in distress, near a broken down wagon.
Continue

Hail! Have you time to stop and help us? We were on our way to Khyn when our cart hit a snag in the road. The wheel is damaged. I'm afraid we cannot leave our goods behind lest robbers descend to prey upon the merchandise. But we need to get our cargo to the city.
I am sorry, but we must leave you to your fate.
Turning from the stranded merchants, you prepare to continue your journey. There is a distinct rustling sound coming from beyond the forest.
It's none of our business. Let's keep moving.
I think we should go back to investigate.
Returning to the broken-down wagon, dark figures emerge from out of the shadows of the trees. Guttural laughter is followed by words croaked out in the common tongue.
Continue
Looks like this will be an even better haul!
Goblins attack!
We are from Hearkenwold. Let us guard your caravan, while you continue to the city to find assistance.

That is most kind and noble of you! To have such Knights of Astaria be watchful of our wares. In fact, we too were just on our route leaving from the Castle. It will not be very long before we return with help from Khyn. Again, I thank you!
Continue

The merchants turn to leave and follow the road to Khyn on foot. After some time has passed, you hear a distinct sound of rustling, movement, coming from beyond the forest. Dark figures emerge from out of the shadows of the trees, accompanied by guttural laughter.
Continue
Looks like this will be an even better haul!
Goblins attack!
Of course we will help you. Perhaps we can go to Khyn and find the tools you need or even replace the wheel.

Well... if you think that is a good idea, a wise course of action. I must trust your judgment. Certainly we will wait here. But please hurry, there are no doubt robbers on the prowl. If night falls and they find us stranded out here, no telling what might happen.
Continue
Turning from the stranded merchants, you prepare to continue your journey. There is a distinct rustling sound coming from beyond the forest.
We have to get to the city and find a new wheel. Let's keep moving.
I think we should go back to investigate.
Returning to the broken-down wagon, dark figures emerge from out of the shadows of the trees. Guttural laughter is followed by words croaked out in the common tongue.
Continue
Looks like this will be an even better haul!
Goblins attack!
What kind of goods are you carrying?

Expecting silver and gold, my friend? Ah don't worry, I can see the gleam in your eye. But our cargo is perhaps more valuable. You see, we are transporting books and rare tomes, to the library of Khyn. I'm sure these would not be of much interest to robbers. But it won't matter if they discover our treasure after they attack. Will you help?
I am sorry, but we must leave you to your fate.
We are from Hearkenwold. Let us guard your caravan, while you continue to the city to find assistance.
Of course we will help you. Perhaps we can go to Khyn and find the tools you need or even replace the wheel.
Has there been trouble with robbers along the King's Road?

Indeed, it is terrible. This used to be a very safe fareway. Of course there were always tribes of goblins in the distant Khrystos Caves. However, between the might of the Castle and the guardian of the southern realm, Fortess Relmfur, none would approach this road so boldly. Merchants could secure safe passage by sticking to the paved path. Now, some trouble is stirring.
Of course we will help you. Perhaps we can go to Khyn and find the tools you need or even replace the wheel.
We are from Hearkenwold. Let us guard your caravan, while you continue to the city to find assistance.
I am sorry, but we must leave you to your fate.

Oh, thank the stars above you came back! Those goblins were lying in wait, for the right moment to strike I am sure. No telling what would have happened had you not returned. We are still a bit shaken up. Now I realize, it is not safe for us to remain out here in the open.
And what do you suggest?

There is a cave nearby. Close enough that we can push our wagon to the entrance, and perhaps devise of cover of leaves and branches. That should provide a measure of safety. If you can manage to get to Khyn and bring a wagon wheel back to us, we can take care of the rest. You will be compensated for your troubles.
All right, we will see what we can do.

Some more time has passed. After half a day goes by, you hear the sound of the merchants returning up the road. As they approach, the man in front is rolling along a new wheel. He greets you with a broad smile.
Continue

Excellent! So glad to still find you here. The blacksmith of Khyn was able to help us out. And as for you, well, we had not planned a budget for a caravan guard... but I think you deserve something for your troubles. Please, take this purse and then we are off again to the city library.
And you be more vigilant on the road you travel. Farewell.

In this spot, you find shattered wood and bent scraps of iron. A whistle of wind passes forlornly through the treerops.This is all that is left of a wagon that has been destroyed. There is no sign of the cargo, however, and as for the merchants, it is as if they have disappeared without a trace.
We cannot stand for such abduction on the King's Road.
I see tracks, leading toward the northeast.
